content: The following lists events that happened during **1975 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Benjamin Henry Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Henry_Sheares) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - 1 January – The Singapore Maritime Museum is opened in [Sentosa](/wiki/Sentosa), albeit still under construction. ### February - 19 February – The first [SAFRA](/wiki/SAFRA_National_Service_Association) clubhouse is opened in Toa Payoh. ### April - 1 April – The [Singapore Air Defence Command](/wiki/Singapore_Air_Defence_Command) is renamed to the [Republic of Singapore Air Force](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force). - 30 April – The new Royal Sporting House outlet officially opens. ### June - 2 June – - The [Area Licensing Scheme](/wiki/Singapore_Area_Licensing_Scheme) (ALS) was launched in a bid to control traffic into the city, the world's first area licensing scheme. - The [Jurong Town Hall](/wiki/Jurong_Town_Hall) is officially opened. It served as the headquarters of the Jurong Town Corporation (now [JTC Corporation](/wiki/JTC_Corporation)) until 2000, spearheading Singapore's economy. ### July - 30 July – The [World Trade Centre](/wiki/HarbourFront_Centre) will be ready by 1977. ### September - 15 September – The Subordinate Courts Building (present day [State Courts](/wiki/State_Courts_of_Singapore)) starts operations, centralising various courts which were scattered around the city at that time including the Criminal District and Magistrates' Court; the Traffic Courts; and the Civil District Courts. - 24 September – The last British warship, HMS Mermaid, left Sembawang Naval Basin. ### November - 20 November – Amendments to the [Misuse of Drugs Act](/wiki/Misuse_of_Drugs_Act_(Singapore)) were passed to introduce the [mandatory death penalty](/wiki/Mandatory_death_penalty) for drug trafficking cases. ### Date unknown - The [Kranji Reservoir](/wiki/Kranji_Reservoir) and [Pandan Reservoir](/wiki/Pandan_Reservoir) are completed. - [DBS Building Tower One](/wiki/OUE_Downtown) is completed. - 3S Transport Pte Ltd starts operations as Singapore's second private charter bus company after Woodlands Transport the previous year. ## Births - 20 January – [Emma Yong](/wiki/Emma_Yong), actress, member of [Dim Sum Dollies](/wiki/Dim_Sum_Dollies) (d. 2012). - 28 January – [Tanya Chua](/wiki/Tanya_Chua), singer. - 19 September – [Michelle Chia](/wiki/Michelle_Chia), actress. - 24 September – [Calvin Cheng](/wiki/Calvin_Cheng), former [Nominated Member of Parliament](/wiki/Nominated_Member_of_Parliament). - 6 December – [Vincent Ng](/wiki/Vincent_Ng), martial artist, actor. - 27 December – [Daniel Ong](/wiki/Daniel_Ong), artiste and radio DJ, co-founder of [Twelve Cupcakes](/wiki/Twelve_Cupcakes). - [Tan Wu Meng](/wiki/Tan_Wu_Meng) – politician. - [Kam Ning](/wiki/Kam_Ning) – violinist. ## Deaths - 14 January – Foo Chee Fong, Chinese businessman and [Hainanese](/wiki/Hainan_people) community leader (b. 1898). - 13 February – [Franklin Gimson](/wiki/Franklin_Gimson), Singapore's first postwar [Governor](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore) and commander-in-chief from 1946 to 1952 (b. 1890). - 24 March – Lim Cheng Lock, former Member of Parliament for [Kampong Kapor Constituency](/wiki/Kampong_Kapor_Constituency) (b. 1924). - 20 June – [Alan Rose](/wiki/Alan_Rose), 1st [Chief Justice of the State of Singapore](/wiki/Chief_Justice_of_Singapore) (b. 1899). - 20 July – Syed Ibrahim bin Omar Alsagoff, head of local Arab companies and consul for several Arab countries (b. 1899). - 6 November – [Wilfred Lawson Blythe](/wiki/Wilfred_Lawson_Blythe), 2nd [Colonial Secretary of Singapore](/wiki/Colonial_Secretary_of_Singapore) (b. 1896).[*citation needed*] - 13 November – [Neo Ao Tiew](/wiki/Neo_Ao_Tiew), Chinese businessman, philanthropist and a pioneer of [Lim Chu Kang](/wiki/Lim_Chu_Kang) (b. 1884).
